source_sentence: 阿吒薄俱元帥大將上佛陀羅尼
translation: Admiral Aṭavika Bhagavān, the supreme buddha-dhāraṇī
Sutra of the Ritual Procedure for Cultivation, Volume 2

source_sentence: 唐大善無畏內道場祕譯
translation: Tang Translation of the Secret of the Great Fearless Inner Way

source_sentence: 歸命十方等正覺　　最勝妙法菩薩眾　我身口意清淨業　　至心傾誠合掌禮　唯願諸佛法僧眾　　慈悲哀愍攝護我　敬禮元帥大將軍　　此是毘盧遮那身　及以釋迦諸佛變　　觀音無盡無邊化　或現菩薩喜悅形　　兩臂與諸願印相　或示金剛忿怒身　　四手執器降魔相　元帥本體是如來　　為救世間現種種　四面八臂堅利牙　　執持器杖隨類護　若有國王歸元帥　　即領一切將軍眾　守護彼王國境內　　消伏隣王怨敵事　摧滅逆臣自調伏　　國內無諸疾疫苦　一切世間有情類　　念持神呪稱名號　淨除內外所生障　　必與世間出世願　欲息災者即息災　　求榮愛者施榮愛　降伏惡等一切業　　一一無不成就者　若聞阿吒薄俱名　　口裏一誦讚歎者　常當擁護無諸難　　世間寶貨悉圓備　阿吒薄俱領眷屬　　摧碎金剛青面王　蘇悉地王軍吒利　　密迹力士摩登伽　梵釋四王自在天　　二十八部藥叉王　四十二部羅剎娑　　犍闥龍王鳩槃荼　天魔鬼神併驅使　　閻浮眾生亦如是　能歸依者得勝利　　生謗逆者被重禍　是故一切世間人　　悉應歸依大元帥次結請十方諸佛印。
translation: I take refuge in the great commander of the bodhisattvas of the ten directions, the most excellent and wonderful Dharma, and I wholeheartedly bow with folded palms to the pure activities of body, speech, and mind. I wish that all the buddhas, Dharma, and saṃgha would have compassion, kindness, and protection for me. I salute the commander of the great general. This is the body of Vairocana and the transformation of the Śākyas, whose voice is endless and limitlessly transformed.

source_sentence: 反叉左右無名指於掌中。
translation: He puts his right and left ring fingers in his palm with their fingers folded.
He straightens his two middle fingers and places them on top of each other.

source_sentence: 屈二食指押中指上節背。
translation: He bends his two index fingers and puts them against the back of the middle finger's upper knuckle.

source_sentence: 並竪二大指押捻中節側。
translation: He raises his two big fingers to the side of his middle knuckle and twists them.
He passes his head and fingers back and forth seven times.
This is called the Sarvâstivāda-dhāraṇī spell.

source_sentence: 唵(一)　闍　耶(二)(余何反)　婆　醯(三)　莎　訶(四)(誦七遍)次結觀世音等諸大菩薩印。
translation: Om(1) 闍や(2)(Yuhosvara) 婆 醯(3)  莎 訶(4) (recited seven times) Next, he makes the sign of Avalokitêśvara and the other great bodhisattvas.
He puts his two palms together.
He puts his two big fingers together.
He does the same with his two pinkies.
The other fingers are scattered, curved, and small.
He spreads them out like a lotus.
He puts his head finger up and sends down a mantra, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)　毘　是　底(二)　毘　伽　藍(三)　迷　帝　盧　迦(四)毘　闍　曳(五)　莎　訶(六)次結十四部金剛印。
translation: Om (1) Vijayti (2) Vaijaram (3) Maitreya (4) Vaijayika (5) Saha (6) Next, he makes the fourteen-part vajra mudrā.
He raises both wrists sideways.

source_sentence: 並二大指各捻二小指甲上。
translation: He twists his two big fingers and twists his two little fingernails together.
He puts his two ring fingers sideways and leans on each other to support his head.
The two middle fingers each stand straight up.
Their ends are forward and not pressed against each other.
He says, "Let's pray for the coming and going of the two fingers.

source_sentence: 唵(一)　跋　折羅(二)　旃　抳　醯(三)　莎　訶次結三十三天神印。
translation: Om(1) vajra(2) chandha(3) sahā Next, he sets the seal of the Trāyastriṃśa gods.

source_sentence: 二頭指稍去中指第二節半分許。
translation: He places his two forefingers slightly past the second knuckle of his middle finger by about half a point.
He then makes the seal of the Trāyastriṃśa gods, placing his two fingers slightly below the second knuckle of his middle finger by about half a point.

source_sentence: 唵(一)　鑠　覩嚕(二)　跛羅　魔　陀　儞　曳(三)　莎訶次結二十八部星宿天印。
translation: "Om(1) 鑠 śatru(2) Ṛmra, Mātṛkā, and Śākya(3), then he makes the sign of the twenty-eight astral celestials.

source_sentence: 以左手中指無名指並仰。
translation: He takes the middle finger of his left hand and raises his ring finger together.

source_sentence: 右中指在左無名指下文上。
translation: The right middle finger goes over the left ring finger below it.

source_sentence: 右無名指亦覆左中指下文上。
translation: The right ring finger also goes over the bottom of the left middle finger.
The general shape of the mudrā is like a cord.

source_sentence: 小指頭指大指各竪相拄。
translation: The little finger, the tip of the finger, and the big finger each point to the other.
The mantra for the coming and going of the big finger is.

source_sentence: 唵(一)　曩　乞叉　多羅(二)　提　婆　多　曳(三)　莎訶次結東方提頭賴吒天王領乾闥婆軍眾印。
translation: Om (1) Ānanda Kikṣa Tārā (2) Devadatta (3) Śākha Next, he sets the seal of the army of Ganymede, led by the eastern god Dhṛtarāṣṭra.

source_sentence: 側左手中指已下三指把拳。
translation: He puts his left hand in a fist with the middle finger and three fingers below.
He also bends his head finger a little to bend it.
He places a verse on the bottom knuckle of his middle finger.
The great finger-returning mantra says.

source_sentence: 唵(一)　地利　底(二)　曷羅　瑟吒(三)　藥　叉(四)　因陀羅(五)　帝　波　多　曳(六)　莎　訶次結南方毘樓勒叉天王領鳩槃荼眾印。
translation: Om (1) Dṛti (2) Rāṣṭrapāla (3) Yakṣa (4) Indra (5) Devadatta (6) Sahā Next, he makes the sign of the southern Virūḍhaka god king who leads the Kumbhâṇḍa army.
He puts his left wrist to the side.

source_sentence: 以右手腕側著左腕根上。
translation: He puts his right wrist sideways on the base of his left wrist.
He puts his two palms back together.
He hooks his two ring fingers together.
He applies them like a noose.
He bends his two pinkies and two big fingers a little.
He says, "A spell for the coming and going of the forefinger.

source_sentence: 唵(一)　毘　嚕　陀　迦　耶(二)　波　多　曳(三)　莎　訶次結西方毘樓博叉天王領龍軍眾印。
translation: Om(1) vītu-dākāya(2) bātā-śrī(3) sahā Next, he makes the sign of the western Virūpākṣa god king leading the army of dragons.
He puts his left hand at the side of his wrist.

source_sentence: 以右手腕著於左手腕根上。
translation: He puts his right wrist on the base of his left wrist.
He puts his two middle fingers and the three fingers below.
He bends them in his palm and makes a fist.
He bends his two big fingers and puts them each on top of each other.
He interlocks his two big fingers like a rope and tells them to come back up.
The mantra for the coming and going of the big fingers is.

source_sentence: 唵(一)　嚊　嚧　博　叉(二)　鳩　槃　荼(三)　阿　地波　多　曳(四)　莎　訶(五)次結北方毘沙門天王領藥叉軍眾印。
translation: Om (1) Śāriputra bokhara (2) Kumbhâṇḍa (3) Ātivatāra (4) Śākha (5) Next, he makes the sign of the northern Vaiśravaṇa gods leading the Yakṣa army.
He puts his left hand at the side of his wrist.
He also bends his four fingers below his head finger.
Putting them in his palm, he makes a fist.
He bends his big finger and puts it on top of his head finger.
He does the same with his right wrist.
Turning it to the side, he makes a fist.
He straightens his big finger and sends it upward.
He puts his right fist on top of his left fist.
The mantra for the right big finger coming and going is.

source_sentence: 唵(一)　毘　沙　門　耶(二)　阿　地　波　多　曳(三)　莎訶(四)次結四天王所領四方鬼神藥叉羅剎八部鬼兵印。
translation: Om (1) Viśramaṇa (2) Ādi-patra (3) Śākha (4) Next, he makes the sign of the four gods, Yakṣa, Rāṣṭrapāla, and the eight kinds of demon guards.
He puts his palm together with the middle finger of his forked head and the fingers of his palm.
He straightens his ring finger and raises it.
He interlocks his pinkies into his palm and closes his wrists.
The mantra for the coming and going of the big fingers is.

source_sentence: 唵(一)　瞻　皤　羅(二)　謝　連　達羅　耶(三)　莎　呵(四)次結八部龍王軍眾印。
translation: Om (1) Ṛgandhila (2) Śāriputrāya (3) Śākha (4) Next, he makes the sign of the eight part army of dragon kings.
The head of his right elbow is placed inside his left elbow.
Again, he takes the back four fingers of his right hand and bends them a little.
He uses his big finger to bend his big finger less, and then he bends it less.
With his left hand, he bends it the other way.
He points his right hand in the same way.
He uses it to resemble the mouth of a snake.
The spell goes, "Use the second hand with four fingers on each side to come and go.

source_sentence: 唵(一)　漚　波　難　陀(二)　莎　訶次結百千天龍興雲致雨龍王印。
translation: "Om(1) ṇuvana (2) sahā Next, he makes the sign of the dragon king, which is a hundred thousand celestial dragons that produce clouds and rain.
He does not change the position of his left hand or arm as before.

source_sentence: 但以左右手小指無名指。
translation: He simply takes the little finger and ring finger of his left and right hands.
They are folded backwards into the palm of the right hand and placed to the left.
He points his two middle fingers straight up and leans on each other.
He puts his two index fingers against the upper knuckle on the back of his middle finger.
He bends his two big fingers a little.
He puts his two index fingers on the inner middle knuckle of each finger.
The mantra for the coming and going of the forefinger is.

source_sentence: 唵(一)　步　耆　羅(二)　莎　訶(三)次結日天子軍眾印。
translation: Om(1) bu gila(2) sahā(3) Next, he makes the sign of the sun-ruler army.

source_sentence: 先背二中指無名指小指。
translation: First, he backs his two middle fingers and his ring finger and pinky finger.
They're all pressed together inside the palm.
The two index fingers are placed directly up against each other.

source_sentence: 二大指捻頭指根第一節。
translation: He twists the two big fingers around the first knuckle of his head finger.
The mantra for the coming and going of the big finger is.

source_sentence: 唵(一)　喝囉　濕迷(二)　摩　利　儞(三)　莎　訶(四)次結月天子眷屬印。
translation: Om(1) ḍarāśmi(2) śrī-ni(3) sahā(4) Next, he makes the sign of the moon-deva's retinue.

source_sentence: 以二小指無名指掌內相叉。
translation: He takes his two pinky fingers and ring finger and interlocks them in his palm.
He puts his right hand and left hand in his palm.
He ties his middle finger straight up and tangles it with his head finger.
He makes the third knuckle of his middle finger bend.
He makes his big finger angry.
He puts each finger on the tip of his ring finger.
The mantra for the coming and going of the big finger is.

source_sentence: 唵(一)　旃　陀羅　夜(二)　蘇　摩　底(三)　莎　訶(四)次結一切火天魔兵令伏印。
translation: Om(1) Śāntarāja(2) Sumati(3) Śākha(4), then he makes a sign for subduing all the fire demon attendants.
He raises his right hand with three fingers.
He bends his big finger and twists the bottom of his ring finger.
He bends the tip of his first finger slightly.
It's aligned with the first knuckle of the middle finger.
The mantra for the coming and going of the head finger is.

source_sentence: 唵(一)　地　獘　地獘(二)(毘耶反)　阿　伽那　曳(三)　阿　揭車(四)　莎　訶(五)次結閻羅五道大將軍牛頭兵眾印。
translation: Om (1) Dīpaṃkara Dīpaṃkara (2) (Vaiśravaṇa) āgana śrī (3) āgacakra (4) sahā (5) Next, he sets the seal of the great general of the five destinies, the ox-headed soldiers.
He puts his left wrist to his side and grasps it.

source_sentence: 四指仍稍出頭指三分許。
translation: He still holds his four fingers slightly above his head finger for about three minutes.
The great finger-returning mantra says.

source_sentence: 唵(一)　閻　魔　羅　闍(二)　嗚　揭羅　嚊　利耶(三)阿　揭　車(四)　莎　訶(五)次結阿修羅王鬪戰軍眾印。
translation: Om (1) 閻 魔羅 闍 (2) 嗚 闍 Śāriputra (3) Āgāra (4) Śākha (5) Next, he sets the sign of the fighting army of King Asura.

source_sentence: 左手中指以下三指等屈。
translation: He bends his left hand equally with the three fingers below the middle finger.
He puts his forefinger about a minute below his palm.
The tip of the big finger is also slightly bent.

source_sentence: 共東方天王印同令相應呪曰。
translation: Together with the sign of the Eastern Heavenly Kings, they make a corresponding dhāraṇī, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)　毘　摩　質　多羅(二)　阿　蘇　羅(三)　地　波多　曳(四)　莎　訶(五)次結羅剎娑王軍兵鬪戰者急來印。
translation: Om (1) Vimalacitra (2) Asura (3) Dipatthaka (4) Sāhā (5) Next, he makes the sign for King Rāṣṭrapāla's army of fighters.
Take the big finger of your right hand.
Twist the fingernail of your pinky finger over your ring finger.
He applies it to his middle finger and forefinger.
The head-finger come-and-go mantra says.

source_sentence: 唵(一)　揭　伽(二)　阿　地　波　多　曳(三)　莎　訶(四)次結五方大力藥叉王軍眾印。
translation: Om (1) ガ 伽 (2) Ādi bā tāyai (3) ṣa ha (4) Next, he makes the sign of the five great armies of King Yakṣa.

source_sentence: 以左手四指向下鉤右手。
translation: He hooks his right hand with the four fingers of his left hand pointing down.
He points his two large fingers straight up and angrily reminds them.
The spell for the two fingers coming and going says.

source_sentence: 唵(一)　拘　嚊　羅(二)　莎　訶(三)次結阿利陀遮文荼印。
translation: Om (1) Kauśāmbī (2) Śākha (3) Next, he makes the sign Ariṣṭa-cāṭavana.

source_sentence: 二頭指中指無名指相絞。
translation: He twists his two forefingers, middle finger, and ring finger together.
He interlocks his pinky fingers.
He interlocks his big fingers with the top finger.
The mantra for the coming and going of the big finger is.

source_sentence: 唵(一)　胡　嚧　胡嚧(二)　遮　文　荼(三)(徒皆反)　莎　訶(四)次結毘那夜迦鬼神王印。
translation: Om(1) śrāvaka, śrāvaka, and śrāvatas(2) Śākya, Śākya, and Śākya(3) (all reversed) Śākya(4) Next, he makes the sign of the demon king Vinathya.
First, he raises three fingers.

source_sentence: 二無名指相叉垂下向掌背。
translation: He crosses his two ring fingers and puts them down toward the back of his palm.
The second big finger goes straight up and attaches to the side of the head finger.
The mantra for the coming and going of the big finger is.

source_sentence: 唵(一)　薄　迦　羅　準　荼(二)　阿　地　波　多　曳(三)莎　訶(四)次結摩醯首羅天王二十八部印。
translation: Om (1) Pokkharasandha (2) Adipatra (3) Sahā (4) Next, he makes the twenty-eight part sign of the Mahêśvara god king.
He hooks his pinky finger inward with the finger with no name.
He then crosses his middle fingers with the upright part of his hand.
He also raises each of his two forefingers.
He attaches them to the bottom of his middle finger's lateral nail.
He also raises his two big fingers near them.
The mantra for the coming and going of the forefinger is.

source_sentence: 唵(一)　摩　醯　首　羅　耶(二)　莎　訶次結阿吒薄拘元帥大怒使金剛二十八部神降伏惡鬼印。
translation: "Om(1) Mahêśvara(2) Śākya (2) Āṭavika, the commander in chief, becomes furious and causes the twenty-eight vajra spirits to subdue evil spirits with their mudrās.
He greets them while sitting with his right and left hands.
He makes a sharp fist and becomes angry on the inside.
He strikes his teeth three times and then toes his lower lip.

source_sentence: 以下二手拳捺著二腿上。
translation: He presses his lower fist against his two legs with his second hand.
This is the general's body mudrā.

source_sentence: 惡鬼神自打自縛自求死乞命。
translation: It causes evil spirits to beat themselves up, bind themselves up, and beg for their lives.

source_sentence: 次結阿吒薄拘大將大悅會天龍鬼神自護身印。
translation: Next, he makes the seal of Aṭavika, the general, the great joyful assembly, the gods and dragons, and the spirits themselves to protect their bodies.
He takes his right and left two large fingers.

source_sentence: 捻二無名指中節內左右。
translation: He twists the middle knuckle of his two ring fingers inside and to the left and right.

source_sentence: 百事不畏不被刀兵鬼神傷。
translation: He'll be unafraid of all things and won't be harmed by swords, armies, or ghosts.

source_sentence: 次結阿吒婆拘著衣甲印。
translation: Next, he puts the seal of Aṭavika's robe and armor.
He takes his left hand and puts his sword against it.
With his right hand, he wraps it three times around his head with his empty hand.
He wraps his sleeve around his robe and makes a gesture of hanging his teeth.
The demons see them all clad in armor.
He recites the great dhāraṇī twenty-one times.

source_sentence: 次結阿吒婆拘千輻輪降鬼印。
translation: Next, he sets the seal of Aṭavika's thousand-spoked wheel for subduing demons.
He takes his right hand and places his big toe on the middle knuckle of his middle finger and ring finger.

source_sentence: 押中指無名指中節背上。
translation: He places it on the back of the middle finger and the middle knuckle of his ring finger.
It's shaped like a vajra seal.
Next, he makes the seal of Āṭavika standing up.
He correctly stands and bends his right foot.
He takes the four fingers of his left hand from the head finger down.
He straddles them in front of him.
With his right hand, he takes his big toe.

source_sentence: 押中指以下三指背上中節。
translation: He puts his middle finger and the three fingers below his middle finger on the back of his middle knuckle.
He points his head finger forward and explains it.
He'll point to all illnesses and they'll be healed.
He'll point to the subduing of all demons and ghosts.
Pointing to the surface of a river or ocean, he instantly dries it up.
Next, he makes the seal of the Āṭavika sword.

source_sentence: 取石榴枝長三尺二寸呪三遍。
translation: Take a pomegranate branch that's 3 feet 2 inches long and recite the spell three times.

source_sentence: 右手把一頭左手三摩之。
translation: He puts his right hand on one end and rubs it three times with his left hand.
The demon sees this as a sword.
He puts his left hand over it and straddles it.
With his right hand, he takes it like a vajra thrusting a vajra.
Next, he makes the seal of Aṭavika's bow and arrow.
With his left hand, he takes his big finger and puts it between his head finger and ring finger and fingernail.

source_sentence: 押頭指無名指小指甲上。
translation: He puts his forefinger, ring finger, and pinky finger on top of it.

source_sentence: 以右手無名指小指屈在掌中。
translation: With his right hand, he bends the little finger of his ring finger into his palm.
He puts his big finger on the middle fingernail of his head finger.
Putting it to the side of the middle finger of the left hand.
He places the big toe of his right hand on top of the big toe.
He snaps his fingers together.
These are the seven dharma agreements.
He uses the spell of care to incantate them.
This is the careful mantra, which says.

source_sentence: 南　無(一)　多　律(二)　多　勃　律(三)　婆　羅　勃　律(四)柘　頡　迷　柘　頡　迷(五)　怛羅　散　淡(六)　嗚鹽　毘(七)　莎　訶(八)次結阿吒婆拘降伏大魔鬼神印。
translation: "Nam mo(i) tuolu(ii) tuolu(iii) bāla bhulu(iv) cakravartī mazes cakravartī mazes(v) trāyastriṃśa(vi) oyin vai(vii) sahā(viii) Next, he sets the seal of Aṭavakṣa to subdue the great demon spirit.
He sits with his feet hanging out.
He makes a sharp fist with his right and left hands.
He presses his right and left hands together and puts them on his left and right legs.
He quickly strikes his upper lip and toques his lower lip.
He cracks his eye socket and looks at it.
This is the great sign of subjugation.
Next, he makes the sign for binding all demons.

source_sentence: 以左右手二小指反相叉。
translation: He takes his left and right hands and crosses his two pinkies backwards.

source_sentence: 以二大指押二小指甲上。
translation: He puts his two big fingers on top of his two little fingernails. His middle finger and ring finger rise.
He raises his middle finger and ring finger.
He does the same with his head finger.
Next, he makes the sign for sending commands to the demons.
"If he commands a demon, then he'll sit on his side.
He'll sit facing away from it.
He takes his left hand and puts his arm across.
With his right hand, he takes his big finger and puts it on the fingernail of his little finger.
He puts his pinky finger on top of his ring fingernail.
He straightens the middle finger of the index finger.
Next, he makes the fire-wheel sign.

source_sentence: 若伏大力惡鬼作火輪印。
translation: If he subdues a powerful evil spirit, he makes the fire-wheel sign.
He takes his right and left ring fingers and puts them on his palm.
He bends them in his palm so that his heads are aligned.
